BodyName: Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Women's Issues

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to retaliatory personnel actions by employers and wage transparency.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Retaliatory personnel actions by employers and wage transparency.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation granting New York City the authority to set its own minimum wage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Granting NYC the authority to set its own minimum wage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation to grant the City of New York the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Grant NYC the authority to enforce State worker protection laws.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, A.5501, strengthening the provisions of the Wage Theft Prevention Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for New York’s working families
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Paid Family Leave Act to provide support and security for NY’s working families.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Women's Issues

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of an office of labor standards, and to repeal subdivision (i) of section 20-a of such charter and section 20-925 of such code, relating to the designation of an agency to enforce the Earned Sick Time Act
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Relating to the designation of an agency to enforce the Earned Sick Time Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass, and the Governor to sign A.6075, which would amend the labor law, in relation to the prohibition of differential pay based on gender.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Prohibition of differential pay based on gender. (A.6075/S.1)

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Cumbo, Kallos, Johnson, Crowley, Mealy and Lander
